items.from_string:
Title: Create Langfuse Prototype (SBX) with Chart-Deployed Dependencies 
###Value Statement
As an Infrastructure Engineer, I need to deploy Langfuse to the sbx-kubernetes cluster with all dependencies running in-cluster so I can validate the basic deployment and enable LLM tracing functionality.

###Acceptance Criteria
Langfuse is deployed in the bip-ai namespace on sbx cluster via ArgoCD
Users can sign up and log in via the web UI
Langfuse is accessible via internal ALB at langfuse-sbx.bip.va.gov
All chart-deployed dependencies are running: PostgreSQL, ClickHouse, Redis/Valkey, S3(MinIO)
Wrapper Helm chart created in bip-ai-infrastructure repo
Values files created in bip-ai-infrastructure-values repo for sbx
Assumptions
The sbx-kubernetes cluster has sufficient capacity for all in-cluster dependencies
AWS Load Balancer Controller is installed and configured
ArgoCD is configured and can deploy from the repos
Dependencies
None

###Notes
Uses official Langfuse Helm chart v1.5.19 as dependency in wrapper chart
Chart-deployed PostgreSQL (Bitnami) for database
Chart-deployed ClickHouse (Bitnami) for analytics (stays in-cluster per requirements)
Chart-deployed Redis/Valkey (Bitnami) for caching (temporary - will migrate to ElastiCache)
Chart-deployed MinIO (Bitnami) for S3-compatible storage (temporary - will migrate to S3)
ZooKeeper deployed as part of ClickHouse subchart
Secrets: langfuse-secrets with salt and nextauth-secret keys must be created before deployment
Redis auth disabled for initial deployment (needs proper secret management)
Out of Scope
RDS integration (Ticket 2)
S3 integration (Ticket 3)
ElastiCache integration (Ticket 4)
Production-grade secret management
Monitoring and alerting
Load testing
items.to_string:
Title: Create Langfuse Prototype (SBX) with Chart-Deployed Dependencies 

###Value Statement
As an Infrastructure Engineer, I need to deploy Langfuse to the sbx-kubernetes cluster with all dependencies running in-cluster so I can validate the basic deployment and enable LLM tracing functionality.

###Acceptance Criteria
Langfuse is deployed in the bip-ai namespace on sbx cluster via ArgoCD
Users can sign up and log in via the web UI
Langfuse is accessible via internal ALB at langfuse-sbx.bip.va.gov
All chart-deployed dependencies are running: PostgreSQL, ClickHouse, Redis/Valkey, S3(MinIO)
Wrapper Helm chart created in bip-ai-infrastructure repo
Values files created in bip-ai-infrastructure-values repo for sbx

###Assumptions
The sbx-kubernetes cluster has sufficient capacity for all in-cluster dependencies
nginx controller is installed and configured
ArgoCD is configured and can deploy from the repos

###Dependencies
None

###Notes
Uses official Langfuse Helm chart v1.5.19 as dependency in wrapper chart
Chart-deployed PostgreSQL (Bitnami) for database
Chart-deployed ClickHouse (Bitnami) for analytics (stays in-cluster per requirements)
Chart-deployed Redis/Valkey (Bitnami) for caching (temporary - will migrate to ElastiCache)
Chart-deployed MinIO (Bitnami) for S3-compatible storage (temporary - will migrate to S3)
ZooKeeper deployed as part of ClickHouse subchart
Secrets: langfuse-secrets with salt and nextauth-secret keys must be created before deployment
Redis auth disabled for initial deployment (needs proper secret management)
Out of Scope
RDS integration (Ticket 2)
S3 integration (Ticket 3)
ElastiCache integration (Ticket 4)
Production-grade secret management
Monitoring and alerting
Load testing
This issue is cloned by BIP-31072

items.from_string: TERA: Update Jenkins roles for stage and preprod
items.to_string: Run Jenkins updated core role for stage batch pipeline and update stage + preprod DB secret

items.from_string:
Title: TERA: Update Jenkins roles for stage and preprod
Value Statement: "The TERA team needs to move away from their old cpui resources to the new core resources. This ticket is to update the Jenkins jobs in stage + preprod and any code such as the config or other adjustments needed"

AC
- Jenkins jobs updated, tested, and switched in stage + preprod
items.to_string:
AC * Successful run of batch pipeline job with new role
 * Creation of new database secrets for new domains in stage + preprod

items.from_string:
Title: Deploy Unified Jira MCP

Value Statement: As an Infra Engineer, I want to deploy Unified self-hosted Jira MCP in sbxmgmt and mgmt to utilize a central-management k8s style MCP instead of local hosted MCP.

A/C:

- Deploying the helm charts + template + values to sbxmgmt through ArgoCD
- Testing and verifying the deployment is successful (pods running, ingress healthy, basic endpoints responding)
- Deploying to mgmt cluster (infrastructure only, without user rollout)

Points: 5
items.to_string:
Title: Deploy Unified Jira MCP

Value Statement: As an Infra Engineer, I want to deploy Unified self-hosted Jira MCP in sbxmgmt and mgmt to utilize a central-management k8s style MCP instead of local hosted MCP.

A/C:
 - Deploying the helm charts + template + values to sbxmgmt through ArgoCD
 - Testing and verifying the deployment is successful (pods running, ingress healthy, basic endpoints responding)

Points: 5

items.from_string:
Title: Deploy Unified Jira MCP

Value Statement: As an Infra Engineer, I want to deploy Unified self-hosted Jira MCP in sbxmgmt and mgmt to utilize a central-management k8s style MCP instead of local hosted MCP.

items.to_string:
Title: Deploy Unified Jira MCP

Value Statement: As an Infra Engineer, I want to deploy Unified self-hosted Jira MCP in sbxmgmt and mgmt to utilize a central-management k8s style MCP instead of local hosted MCP.

A/C:
 - Deploying the helm charts + template + values to sbxmgmt through ArgoCD
 - Testing and verifying the deployment is successful (pods running, ingress healthy, basic endpoints responding)
 - Making sure MCP server is set up in VS Code and able to communicate to Jira website by talking to the MCP Server through VS Code Github Copilot Chat

Points: 5

items.from_string:
Title: User Testing, Validation, and Production Deployment

Value Statement: As an Infrastructure Engineer, I want to onboard pilot users and deploy to production, so that we can validate the multi-user architecture and make the service available to all users.

A/C:

- User documentation created (token acquisition, mcp.json configuration, troubleshooting) and 5-10 pilot users onboarded in sbxmgmt for testing

- Multi-user validation complete: concurrent users don't interfere, each user sees only their accessible data, and Jira audit logs show actual usernames

- Performance testing completed and service fully deployed to mgmt cluster at https://ai.bip.va.gov/mcp/atlassian with user rollout

- Monitoring/alerting configured and user migration plan communicated

Points: 5
items.to_string:
Title: User Testing, Validation, and Production Deployment

Value Statement: As an Infrastructure Engineer, I want to onboard pilot users and deploy to production, so that we can validate the multi-user architecture and make the service available to all users.

A/C:
 - User documentation created (token acquisition, mcp.json configuration, troubleshooting) and 5-10 pilot users onboarded in sbxmgmt for testing
 - Multi-user validation complete: concurrent users don't interfere, each user sees only their accessible data, and Jira audit logs show actual usernames
 - Monitoring/alerting configured and user migration plan communicated

Points: 5

items.from_string: Title Develop tenant console prototype to enable user testing Value Statement As an infrastructure engineer who manages the MLOps platform, I need the ability to develop and deploy a tenant console prototype so that users can begin testing tenant management functionality. Acceptance Criteria When a user navigates to ai.sbx-mgmt.bip.va.gov, the user has the ability to access the tenant console. Tenant console is integrated into the MLOps UI. Tenant console API endpoints are added to the MLOps API. Tenant console is deployed in the sbx environment. Documentation is updated N/A Automated or manual tests were added N/A Assumptions MLOps UI and API codebases are available for modification. The ai.sbx-mgmt.bip.va.gov domain/routing can be configured. Dependencies None. Notes This is a prototype for initial user testing. Integration points: MLOps UI (frontend) and MLOps API (backend).
items.to_string: Value Statement As a platform admin who manages tenant settings, I need the ability to configure tenant settings dynamically via the Tenant API so that the bip platform can support flexible configuration per tenant. Acceptance Criteria When a platform admin manages a tenant, the admin has the ability to create, read, update, and delete tenant configuration settings via the Tenant API. When a platform admin manages a tenant, the admin has the ability to manage a services model under the tenant. The Tenant API persists data in a Postgres database. The Tenant API aligns with the new data model.

items.from_string:
Title: 2.2 - Provide adhoc support to GenAnn team to resolve technical issues 
Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant on the GenAnn team, I need the ability to receive timely support so that I can resolve issues and continue my work without unnecessary delays. 
Acceptance Criteria: When a user from GenAnn requests support, the support team responds and assists as needed. Manual validation: Confirm support requests are tracked and resolved. Update deployment dates in Confluence for each support ticket.
items.to_string: Value Statement: As an SE supporting the tenant, I need to provide ongoing guidance and remove obstacles for the Gen-Ann team as they update their legacy analytics pipeline's business logic, so that they can successfully implement their changes despite having limited background with the inherited pipeline, leveraging my familiarity with the system. AC: - Hold recurring support meetings and working sessions with the Gen-Ann team throughout the week. Providing KT as needed. - Ensure the Gen-Ann team has clear answers to technical questions about the pipeline architecture and implementation. - Identify and remove any blockers preventing the tenant from making progress on their business logic updates. - Support any updates and deployments of base images that the tenant may need.

items.from_string: Title: Preprod: Update EventBridge rule for multi-tenant telemetry to target IaC Lambda Value Statement: As a BIP-AI engineer who routes telemetry for Bedrock services, I need the ability to update the EventBridge rule to invoke the multi-tenant logger Lambda in Preprod, so that logs from the central group are processed and routed to the correct tenant destinations automatically. Acceptance Criteria: - When new logs arrive in the main Bedrock log group in preprod, the EventBridge rule triggers the deployed router Lambda. - The EventBridge rule configuration is updated in IaC and points to the Lambda created in the associated infrastructure stack.
items.to_string: Value Statement: As a machine learning engineer who maintains custom logging solutions for batch inference and BDA I need to promote the existing solutions in dev to the stage environment Acceptance Criteria: - Image based bda-logger lambda created in preprod and connected to EB rule - project-bip-ai-bda-events EB rule created in preprod and connected to lambda - tested by kicking off a BDA job - Image based batch-job-logger lambda created in preprod and connected to EB rule - project-bip-ai-bedrock-job-events created in preprod and connected to lambda - tested by kicking off a batch inference job
This issue is cloned by BIP-30790

Acceptance Criteria: - When new logs arrive in the main Bedrock log group in preprod, the EventBridge rule triggers the deployed router Lambda. - The EventBridge rule configuration is updated in IaC and points to the Lambda created in the associated infrastructure stack.
items.to_string: Value Statement: As a machine learning engineer who maintains custom logging solutions for batch inference and BDA I need to promote the existing solutions in dev to the stage environment Acceptance Criteria: - Image based bda-logger lambda created in stage and connected to EB rule - project-bip-ai-bda-events EB rule created in stage and connected to lambda - tested by kicking off a BDA job - Image based batch-job-logger lambda created in stage and connected to EB rule - project-bip-ai-bedrock-job-events created in stage and connected to lambda - tested by kicking off a batch inference job

items.from_string:
Value Statement: As a mlops engineer who builds tenant agnostic pipelines, I need to add a deployment module for sagemaker pipelines into mlkit so that the deployment workflow can be easily imported and extended

Acceptance Criteria - deployment module created in mlkit for sagemaker pipelines - mlkit CLI command aded to deploy sagemaker pipelines - tested with at least one real deployment
items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a devops engineer who manages Harness pipelines I need to retest and add role assumption to the existing Harness pipelines to enforce least privilege permissions and ensure all pipelines are in a working state

Acceptance Criteria:
- Added role assumption to all tenant agnostic pipelines
- Retested all tenant agnostic pipelines to ensure they are in a working state

 * Create slides and prepare presentation
 * Present this demo at the Tenant Support Forum

items.to_string: Create GitHub Enterprise teams for BIP AI to enable organized repository access and collaboration **Value Statement** As a BIP AI DevOps engineer who manages platform infrastructure and team collaboration, I need the ability to create properly structured GitHub Enterprise teams for BIP AI so that team members have appropriate repository access, clear permission boundaries, and streamlined collaboration workflows across infrastructure and tenant projects. **Acceptance Criteria** When a user completes the GitHub Enterprise team setup, the user has the ability to assign team members to appropriate teams with correct repository access permissions and collaboration capabilities. * **Functionality that will validate that this story is complete** * GitHub Enterprise teams created for BIP AI organizational structure (Infrastructure, MLOps, Tenant Support, Security) * Team membership properly assigned based on current team roles and responsibilities * Repository access permissions configured according to least-privilege principles * Team-based access controls implemented for sensitive repositories * Branch protection rules aligned with team responsibilities * Team notification settings configured for relevant repository activities * **Documentation is updated** in Confluence with: * GitHub Enterprise team structure and access matrix * Team membership guidelines and role definitions **Assumptions** * GitHub Enterprise Cloud instance is provisioned and accessible for team creation * Current team organizational structure and role definitions will be provided by management * Repository migration to GitHub Enterprise Cloud will be completed or planned concurrently **Dependencies** This Story is dependent on the completion of: GitHub Enterprise Cloud provisioning and initial setup **Notes** Per our conversations with the platform team, the following information may be useful: * Current team structure includes Infrastructure, MLOps, and various tenant support roles * Different teams require different levels of access to infrastructure vs tenant repositories * Some repositories contain sensitive configuration and should have restricted access * Team structure should align with current Jira project permissions and responsibilities * Consider future scaling as new team members join or roles change **Out of Scope** * Individual user account provisioning (handled separately) * Repository migration from existing platforms * Custom GitHub Enterprise applications or integrations * Advanced security features beyond standard team-based access controls * Automated team membership management (manual process initially)

instance is provisioned and accessible for team creation * Current team organizational structure and role definitions will be provided by management * Repository migration to GitHub Enterprise Cloud will be completed or planned concurrently {*}{{*}}Dependencies{{*}}{*} This Story is dependent on the completion of: GitHub Enterprise Cloud provisioning and initial setup {*}{{*}}Notes{{*}}{*} Per our conversations with the platform team, the following information may be useful: * Current team structure includes Infrastructure, MLOps, and various tenant support roles * Different teams require different levels of access to infrastructure vs tenant repositories * Some repositories contain sensitive configuration and should have restricted access * Team structure should align with current Jira project permissions and responsibilities * Consider future scaling as new team members join or roles change {*}{{*}}Out of Scope{{*}}{*} * Individual user account provisioning (handled separately) * Repository migration from existing platforms * Custom GitHub Enterprise applications or integrations * Advanced security features beyond standard team-based access controls * Automated team membership management (manual process initially)

Document and evaluate LiteLLM for unified LLM provider interface Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps engineer who manages multiple LLM integrations across tenants, I need the ability to document and evaluate LiteLLM as a unified interface for multiple LLM providers so that I can standardize LLM access patterns and enable seamless switching between different AI model providers. Acceptance Criteria When a user completes this evaluation, the user has the ability to understand LiteLLM's capabilities, limitations, and integration requirements for the BIP AI platform. Functionality that will validate that this story is complete Comprehensive documentation of LiteLLM features and capabilities Proof-of-concept implementation with at least 3 different LLM providers (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Azure OpenAI) Performance benchmarking results comparing direct provider APIs vs LiteLLM interface Cost analysis and overhead assessment Security and compliance evaluation for VA requirements Integration architecture recommendations for BIP AI platform Documentation is updated in Confluence with: LiteLLM evaluation report and findings Integration guidelines and best practices Comparison matrix with current LLM integration approaches Automated or manual tests were added The business will provide clarity on approved LLM providers and usage policies prior to this story being picked up Access to multiple LLM provider APIs will be available for testing purposes Security team will provide guidance on any additional security requirements for unified LLM interfaces

Value Statement: As an Infrastructure Engineer, I want to build the token injector sidecar and deploy the MCP infrastructure to dev environment, so that we can validate the OAuth2 and Vault integration retrieves the correct user tokens. Acceptance Criteria - Token injector sidecar built and pushed to Nexus registry - Helm charts created for MCP server with sidecar configuration - Infrastructure deployed to dev with ingress accessible at https://jira-mcp.dev.bip.va.gov - Token injector successfully retrieves test tokens from Vault based on OAuth2 user identity

items.from_string: Build Token Injector and Deploy to Dev
items.to_string: Build Container Image and Configure CI/CD

items.from_string: Value Statement: As an Infrastructure Engineer, I want to build the token injector sidecar and deploy the MCP infrastructure to dev environment, so that we can validate the OAuth2 and Vault integration retrieves the correct user tokens. Acceptance Criteria - Token injector sidecar built and pushed to Nexus registry - Helm charts created for MCP server with sidecar configuration - Infrastructure deployed to dev with ingress accessible at https://jira-mcp.dev.bip.va.gov - Token injector successfully retrieves test tokens from Vault based on OAuth2 user identity
items.to_string: Value Statement: As an Infrastructure Engineer, I want to build the custom MCP server image and configure automated pipelines, so that code changes automatically deploy to our container registry. Acceptance Criteria -Dockerfile created and Nexus repository bip-ai/bip-ai-mcp-atlassian configured -GitHub Actions workflow builds and pushes images to Nexus on commits to main/develop -Image scanning configured and test image successfully pushed -Version tagging strategy documented and validated

Value Statement As an Infrastructure Engineer, I want to fork the MCP Atlassian server and modify it to accept individual user tokens from request headers, so that multiple users can authenticate with their own Jira credentials instead of sharing a single service account. Acceptance Criteria - Repository department-of-veterans-affairs/mcp-atlassian created and forked from sooperset/mcp-atlassian - Token middleware implemented to extract X-Jira-Token from request headers -Jira client modified to use per-request tokens instead of a single environment variable -Unit tests pass demonstrating two different tokens retrieve different Jira data

items.from_string: Fork and Modify Jira MCP Server for Per-User Authentication
items.to_string: Fork Jira MCP Server and Implement Per-Request Token Handling

items.from_string: Value Statement As an Infrastructure Engineer, I want to fork the MCP Atlassian server and modify it to accept individual user tokens from request headers, so that multiple users can authenticate with their own Jira credentials instead of sharing a single service account. Acceptance Criteria - Repository department-of-veterans-affairs/mcp-atlassian created and forked from sooperset/mcp-atlassian - Token middleware implemented to extract X-Jira-Token from request headers -Jira client modified to use per-request tokens instead of a single environment variable -Unit tests pass demonstrating two different tokens retrieve different Jira data
items.to_string: Value Statement: As an Infrastructure Engineer, I want to fork the MCP Atlassian server and modify it to accept individual user tokens from request headers, so that the codebase is ready for multi-user deployment. Acceptance Criteria - Repository department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-ai-mcp-atlassian created as fork from sooperset/mcp-atlassian - Token middleware, Jira client, and server entry point modified to extract and use X-Jira-Token header per-request instead of startup environment variable - Unit tests pass demonstrating different tokens retrieve different Jira data - Code changes documented in README and FORK-CHANGES.md

Value Statement: As an Infrastructure Engineer, I want to onboard real users to the prototype and validate multi-user scenarios, so that we can confirm the end-to-end architecture eliminates Docker requirements while preserving individual Jira audit attribution. Acceptance Criteria - 2-3 pilot users onboarded: tokens registered in Vault and VS Code configured - All pilot users successfully query Jira through the centralized MCP service without Docker - Multi-user validation complete: User A sees only their accessible data, User B sees only their accessible data - Jira audit logs verified showing actual usernames (e.g., "john.smith@va.gov") instead of service account for all MCP actions

items.from_string: Deploy and testing a prototype custom JIRA MCP server to K8s

items.from_string: Differentiate Strands calls in the backend
items.to_string: Value Statement: As a MLE I need a way to differentiate between bedrock and strands agent in the backend to route and log requests properly AC: When a call is made to a strands agent vs bedrock agent it is routed to the correct method and logged accordingly
Value Statement: As a MLE I want to be able to interact with Strands agents from the frontend of ARIA AC: Strands agents listed and ability to chat with using ARIA frontend

items.from_string: Create a GitOps Harness trigger to run the Tenant agnostic pipeline “build image + deploy lambda” on Git change
items.to_string:
As a devops engineer I want a Harness trigger that detects changes in Git (GitOps repository) and automatically runs our pipeline that builds the container image and deploys the Lambda function So that deployments happen consistently and automatically whenever a change is merged/committed, reducing manual steps and ensuring environments stay in sync with Git.
Given a commit is pushed (or PR merged) to the configured repo/branch When the change meets the configured criteria (branch + path filters) Then the Harness trigger fires and starts the target pipeline automatically.

items.from_string:

Given a commit is pushed (or PR merged) to the configured repo/branch When the change meets the configured criteria (branch + path filters) Then the Harness trigger fires and starts the target pipeline automatically.
items.to_string: Value Statement: As a devops engineer I want a Harness trigger that detects changes in Git (GitOps repository) and automatically runs our pipeline that builds the container image and deploys the Lambda function So that deployments happen consistently and automatically whenever a change is merged/committed, reducing manual steps and ensuring environments stay in sync with Git AC: When a user makes a PR in the SPA Agentic Repo (test repo for now since they already have an input set for their lambda- will expand to others later/create an SoP for SEs to follow), the user has the ability to automatically kick off the tenant-agnostic pipeline in Harness w/ the SPA-Agentic lambda input set This can be verified in the execution history of the tenant-agnostic pipeline and of the trigger itself

Value Statement As a BIP AI Engineer who needs to deploy mlkit and deploy new versions, images/LCCs, I need the ability to run a pipeline in Harness that does the aforementioned, so that we can retain this functionality when we move away from Jenkins AC When a user needs to deploy a new mlkit version (or it's done upon a new release), the user has the ability to run the mlkit deployment pipeline in Harness and run integration tests, deploy it to Nexus, build/attach the image/LCCs, mirroring the functionality currently in Jenkins

items.from_string: Integrate SageMaker Processing Jobs Pipeline into Tenant-Agnostic Pipeline
items.to_string:
As a platform/data engineer I want to integrate the SageMaker Processing Jobs pipeline into the tenant-agnostic pipeline by adding a trigger in the SageMaker pipeline and a caller script in the tenant-agnostic pipeline that runs it and reports status back So that SageMaker processing can be executed and monitored consistently as part of the standard tenant-agnostic deployment/run workflow when enabled.
The SageMaker Processing Jobs pipeline exposes a triggerable entry point The trigger supports passing required inputs Tenant-agnostic pipeline includes a script/step that invokes (triggers) the SageMaker Processing Jobs pipeline. The caller script polls or subscribes for run status and reports progress/final outcome back to the tenant-agnostic pipeline. Success is reported only when the SageMaker run completes successfully. Failure is reported with the SageMaker failure reason/message surfaced in logs/output.

Value Statement: As a dev ops engineer, I need the ability to update the existing sagemaker processing jobs Harness pipeline to call the image builder pipeline so standard image deployment procedures are applied Acceptance Criteria: - Harness pipeline for SM processing jobs updated to call the image builder pipeline step template - Tested with at least one SM processing jobs deployment
